titleStmt.title: A proposal for regulating and advancing the woollen manufacture and to make it more profitable to the merchant and maker, than formerly. Humbly offered, to the honourable, Knights, citizens, and burgesses in Parliament assembled: by one who hath had 30 years experience in that trade, and in importing of wool from Ireland.

A proposal for regulating and advancing the woollen manufacture and to make it more profitable to the merchant and maker, than formerly. Humbly offered, to the honourable, Knights, citizens, and burgesses in Parliament assembled: by one who hath had 30 years experience in that trade, and in importing of wool from Ireland.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C..
